content.raw: Hey @sloretz ! Just FYI, I ran out of “pipelines minutes” in my fork from where I originated the PR and that’s why it doesn’t have the green light, although the untested commit have only minor style changes, so after discussing it with Carlos he agreed on approving it anyways. Would you mind taking another look at it? Thanks in advance!

Would you mind taking another look at it? Thanks in advance!

content.raw: @caguero sorry for the style issues, I think I just fixed 'em all. PTAL
content.html: @caguero sorry for the style issues, I think I just fixed 'em all. PTAL

update.description:
This PR extends ign log playback for supporting pause/resume.

FYI @nkoenig
update.title: Added pause/resume to logging

content.raw: Thanks for the feedback, Shane. I completely agree with you about the spurious and the need to check for a predicate. Wouldn't a `wait` with a predicate be enough in this case? IIRC, the `wait_for` is equivalent to a `wait` \+ a timeout, which is not required in this case.
content.html: Thanks for the feedback, Shane. I completely agree with you about the spurious and the need to check for a predicate. Wouldn't a wait with a predicate be enough in this case? IIRC, the wait_for is equivalent to a wait + a timeout, which is not required in this case.

content.raw: Nit: Use single line instead.
content.html: Nit: Use single line instead.

content.raw:
Consider this block instead:

    return _recorded.data  == _played.data &&
           _recorded.type  == _played.type &&
           _recorded.topic == _played.topic;
content.html:
Consider this block instead:

return _recorded.data  == _played.data &&
       _recorded.type  == _played.type &&
       _recorded.topic == _played.topic;

content.raw: I just noticed that you used `notify_all`before to wake up all blocked threads. Is there any reason for using `notify_one` here? Are you assuming a single blocking thread for some reason here?
content.html: I just noticed that you used notify_allbefore to wake up all blocked threads. Is there any reason for using notify_one here? Are you assuming a single blocking thread for some reason here?

content.raw: Could you add a new entry to the Changelog, please?
content.html: Could you add a new entry to the Changelog, please?

content.raw: Could you also check `IsPaused()` in your test?
content.html: Could you also check IsPaused() in your test?

content.raw: Extra `//`
content.html: Extra //

content.raw: Update: Pull request #336 has been merged. Feel free to merge from \`default\`.
content.html: Update: Pull request #336 has been merged. Feel free to merge from `default`.

content.raw: I recommend using `wait_for`. The method `wait` is \[allowed to wake up\]\([https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/thread/condition\_variable/wait](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/thread/condition_variable/wait)\) even if the condition hasn't been set. It looks like each spurious wake up would cause one message to be published while playback is paused before the loop checks `this->paused` again.
content.html: I recommend using wait_for. The method wait is [allowed to wake up](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/thread/condition_variable/wait) even if the condition hasn't been set. It looks like each spurious wake up would cause one message to be published while playback is paused before the loop checks this->paused again.

content.raw: Nit: We follow the Gazebo convention here with the `{` in the next line and space after `if`.
content.html: Nit: We follow the Gazebo convention here with the { in the next line and space after if.

content.raw: Nit: Could you make sure that lines are no longer that 80 chars. I realized that the static checker was not looking into the `log` directory. It’s included in pull request #336. Feel free to merge that branch here to make sure that style is fine.
content.html: Nit: Could you make sure that lines are no longer that 80 chars. I realized that the static checker was not looking into the log directory. It’s included in pull request #336. Feel free to merge that branch here to make sure that style is fine.
